security: The document details specific clandestine activities and operational roles of Mr. Morales within the CIA, including his involvement in "FI, CI, CA and PM operations" in various regions. Revealing these details could expose sensitive intelligence methods, operational tactics, and the nature of CIA involvement in foreign political actions. The document also mentions Morales' role in targeting Latin American military officers, which, if disclosed, could damage diplomatic relations and compromise ongoing intelligence activities. Directly quoting the document: "He developed numerous assets who were later pursued successfully and recruited in the field and he made several significant recruitments of his own."
summary: This document recommends Mr. David S. Morales for the Intelligence Medal of Merit, highlighting his 25 years of service with the CIA, including his work in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia, as well as his involvement in various operations and assignments.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential document recommends David S. Morales for the Intelligence Medal of Merit in recognition of his twenty-five years of dedicated service with the Central Intelligence Agency. Throughout his career, Morales held senior-level positions in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia, participating in Foreign Intelligence, Counterintelligence, Covert Action, and Political Action operations. Noteworthy assignments included serving as Base Chief in Pakse, Laos, Regional Officer in Charge in Nha Trang, Vietnam, and his work with the FR Division targeting Latin American military officers in Washington. Morales' service was marked by commendations from Chiefs of Station, the Director of Central Intelligence, the King of Laos, and the Government of Vietnam; he retired on 31 July 1975, leaving behind a legacy of exceptional skill and dedication.
title: Recommendation for Intelligence Medal of Merit for David S. Morales
